content:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)

  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird

content: Thunderbird's Primary Password was designed ONLY to prevent access to the account passwords. Nothing else. That has caused much confusion and I agree that the issue should be resolved, but I do not anticipate that happening. I share your frustration.
creator: davidsk

content: Se ti riferisci allo spazio sul disco utilizzato da Thunderbird, se lo spazio è esaurito devi espandere la memoria del computer. Se -più probabilmente- ti riferisci allo spazio online della tua casella di posta, dipende dal fornitore. La maggior parte offre l'espansione dello spazio a pagamento.
creator: @next

content: -click to account settings pane - scroll down left side to 'Outgoing Servers (SMTP) and click - edit your SMTP server and change the connection setting to STARTTLS (this may require setting port to 587 or 465 . If that doesn't work please post screenshot of the SMTP settings pane,

content: In compose window, select Options>Priority>Highest
creator: davidsk

content:
1. If you want to set the priority of the email you are composing: (In the Composition Window) Options > Priority > select the priority you want.

2. If you want to see the priority of emails in the Message List Pane, you have to use Table View instead of Cards View.

First, click "Message list display options", and then select "Table View".

Second, click "Select columns to display", and then select "Priority".
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content: - click to addressbook pane - highlight addressbook - click the three dots to the right - choose the csv option

content:
I cannot reset a password, but can offer tips on removing the current one. That is, if the current password is removed, my hope is that you can enter a new password. Here are steps to remove current password: - click settings>privacy&security - click saved passwords and then show passwords - now, highight the rows (normally two) for the account and delete them

The removes the passwords for the account, so you should now be prompted for the password.
creator: davidsk

Try to rebuild the index file of the troubled folder.

content: I don't know why you're having problems updating Thunderbird, but it sure has nothing to do with whether you've donated or not. You're simply being reminded you may donate every time you download the software, but you don't have to for the update to work.
creator: DavidGG

content: And you don't have to donate to download Thunderbird either.
creator: christ1

content: Well, it may be due to your configuration. Nobody here can offer suggestions unless you post a screenshot of your incoming server settings and the complete error messages you may be receiving. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
Don't guess the settings - use smtp.gmail.com, 465, SSL/TLS, or 587, STARTTLS; OAuth2, email address.

Disable antivirus scanning of the profile folder (or remove the AV if it's not Windows Security), and disable VPN if in use.

Check that the affected account is sending on the correct smtp:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1438310

Update to the latest 115: https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.18.0/win64/
creator: sfhowes

content:
Fixed!

587 STARTTLS

Thank You!
creator: jimluckn

content: TBird is a email retriever for your online email server. Your email is still on the online email server you are getting copies to TB to read offline from the online email server. If there is issue of storage that is on your online email server and you need to login to that server to see what is going on with your email account.,
creator: markwarner22
